Acolyte: Tradition. The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld. (Lawful)
Charlatan: Independence. I am a free spirit—no one tells me what to do. (Chaotic)
Criminal: Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
Entertainer: Beauty. When I perform, I make the world better than it was. (Good)
Folk Hero: Respect. People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Good)
Guild Artisan: Community. It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)
Hermit: Greater Good. My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit. (Good)
Noble: Respect. Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
Outlander: Change. Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it. (Chaotic)
Sage: Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
Sailor: Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
Soldier: Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
Urchin: Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)

Acolyte: Charity. I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost. (Good)
Charlatan: Fairness. I never target people who can't afford to lose a few coins. (Lawful)
Criminal: Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
Entertainer: Tradition. The stories, legends, and songs of the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)
Folk Hero: Fairness. No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)
Guild Artisan: Generosity. My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
Hermit: Logic. Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Noble: Responsibility. It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine. (Lawful)
Outlander: Greater Good. It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)
Sage: Beauty. What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
Sailor: Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
Soldier: Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
Urchin: Community. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)

Acolyte: Change. We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world. (Chaotic)
Charlatan: Charity. I distribute the money I acquire to the people who really need it. (Good)
Criminal: Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
Entertainer: Creativity. The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)
Folk Hero: Freedom. Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)
Guild Artisan: Freedom. Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
Hermit: Free Thinking. Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress. (Chaotic)
Noble: Independence. I must prove that I can handle myself without coddling from my family. (Chaotic)
Outlander: Honor. If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole clan. (Lawful)
Sage: Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Sailor: Freedom. The sea is freedom—the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
Soldier: Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
Urchin: Change. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)

Acolyte: Power. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy. (Lawful)
Charlatan: Creativity. I never run the same con twice. (Chaotic)
Criminal: Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
Entertainer: Greed. I'm only in it for the money and fame. (Evil)
Folk Hero: Might. If I become strong, I can take what I want—what I deserve. (Evil)
Guild Artisan: Greed. I'm only in it for the money. (Evil)
Hermit: Power. Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power. (Evil)
Noble: Power. If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do. (Evil)
Outlander: Might. The strongest are meant to rule. (Evil)
Sage: No Limits. Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)
Sailor: Mastery. I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
Soldier: Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
Urchin: Retribution. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)

Acolyte: Faith. I trust that my deity will guide my actions. I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well. (Lawful)
Charlatan: Friendship. Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever. (Good)
Criminal: People. I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
Entertainer: People. I like seeing the smiles on people's faces when I perform. That's all that matters. (Neutral)
Folk Hero: Sincerity. There's no good in pretending to be something I'm not. (Neutral)
Guild Artisan: People. I'm committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Hermit: Live and Let Live. Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble. (Neutral)
Noble: Family. Blood runs thicker than water. (Any)
Outlander: Nature. The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization. (Neutral)
Sage: Power. Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)
Sailor: People. I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Soldier: Live and Let Live. Ideals aren't worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
Urchin: People. I help the people who help me—that's what keeps us alive. (Neutral)

Acolyte: Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god's favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)
Charlatan: Aspiration. I'm determined to make something of myself. (Any)
Criminal: Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
Entertainer: Honesty. Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are. (Any)
Folk Hero: Destiny. Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)
Guild Artisan: Aspiration. I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any)
Hermit: Self-Knowledge. If you know yourself, there's nothing left to know. (Any)
Noble: Noble Obligation. It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me. (Good)
Outlander: Glory. I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. (Any)
Sage: Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)
Sailor: Aspiration. Someday, I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
Soldier: Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)
Urchin: Aspiration. I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)
